intro: Astrochlaena annua, commonly known as the annual astrochlaena, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Its leaves are usually simple, alternate, and covered with fine hairs. Astrochlaena annua is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
